column4: [Chameleon]  , not really safe. While I was working on a file on my NTFS Partition , bam it made my whole NTFS partition went nuts and I lost all my files
I guess FAT32 is the way !
bbbl , gonna edit my init.d (need to adjust some things)
[Chameleon]  , i have to agree with all the experts and you too
As far as I know its very safe to use FAT32
ext2 , yes its possible to read ext2 partitions in windows
damn , i need 530MB to upgrade to 5.10
apt-get clean would make some space for you
'apt-get clean' will delete all of the archived .dev files
: thanks for the tip (why didn't i think of that)
: you see , I'm an RPM guy and now i started to use Debian-based system..i kinda miss yum !
the dpkg system is a beautiful thing, you will learn to love it :D
: i guess i should get used to it..i heard many things about it !
